fields.description:
Whenever I start sourcetree on windows, I get a quick console screen that goes away before I can read it.  I have to re-add my ssh key every time I open source tree.

I also have to re-authenticate my Atlassian account (for bitbucket) every time I open sourcetree before I can clone a remote repo.

This is incredibly frustrating and not usable.
fields.summary: Sourcetree keeps losing ssh key and login details

fields.description: When you right-click a branch and try to change the remote tracking, the menu that is displayed is disabled.

https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-2.1.2.3.exe

fields.description:
Before changing submodule URL:

{code}
[submodule "lib/mylib"]
    path = lib/mylib
    url = https://myserver/scm/lib/mylib.git
    branch = develop
{code}

After changing submodule URL:

{code}
[submodule "lib/mylib"]
    path = lib/mylib
url=https://newserver/scm/lib/mylib.git
    branch = develop
{code}
fields.summary: Changing source URL for submodule messes up .gitmodules indentation

fields.description: Please provide an option to turn that 'feature' off.
fields.summary: The mouseover effect on text is very unpleasant to the eye

fields.description: I have been implementing some code using the libgit2sharp library. In my code I allow the checkout of particular branches. I display a +real+ progress bar during the checkout - much better than the bogus one displayed in SourceTree! (Fyi, I implement a 'LibGit2Sharp.Handlers.CheckoutProgressHandler'.)
fields.summary: Replace dummy Checkout progress bar with real one

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

In a repository with a long history:
 # create a new branch
 # create a commit in this branch
 # switch to another commit
 # delete --force the branch
 # close popup

very long history is loaded afterwards (Message: Fetching older commits...)
fields.summary: After deleting a branch Sourcetree loads long history

fields.description:
On SourceTree, the 3 button to close/resize/minimize button are not working well, it seems like there is the "windows button" on top of them and off the position of the real ones, it happen that I want to close the source tree but it just resize the window :(

!image-2017-05-31-08-58-21-560.png!
fields.summary: Close/Resize/Minimize buttons

fields.description:
As of the update to 2.1.2.3 all branches including closed ones are shown in the BRANCHES tree view for hg repository.

Related community question with screenshots: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/mercurial-hide-closed-branches-in-the-sidebar/qaq-p/591726
fields.summary: (Mercurial) Branches tree shows closed branches

fields.description:
As you can see in the animation below, pressing F5 (or View > Refresh) will bring back incomplete lists of staged/unstaged files and it changes on subsequent refreshes. All I was doing was hitting the F5 key repeatedly. Toward the end of the animation, you can see this also exists in the auto-refresh that happens after staging/unstaging chunks, lines, or files - I staged a hunk and waited - the file disappeared from the list until I hit F5 a few more times.

This is making SourceTree unusable because after I stage a hunk, the file I'm working on disappears until I hit F5 1-n times, rinse and repeat.

  !sourcetree.gif!
fields.summary: Refreshes of file list in working copy missing files and changing each time

fields.description: !http://pastexen.com/i/cW9My3Npkf.png!
fields.summary: uncommitted changes with empty changes

fields.description:
We have seen a number of crash reports related to the open of SourceTree's main Window.

This appears to be due to SourceTree attempting to open using an invalid Window size.

We are currently working on a fix.

*WorkAround*

While waiting for the fix, you should be able to workaround the bug by editing the following file

{code}
%localappdata%\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_URL_{hash}\2.1.2.3\user.config
{code}

and setting the following values
{code}
...
            <setting name="MainWindowWidth" serializeAs="String">
                <value>500</value>
            </setting>
            <setting name="MainWindowHeight" serializeAs="String">
                <value>400</value>
            </setting>
            <setting name="MainWindowState" serializeAs="String">
                <value>Normal</value>
            </setting>
...
{code}

Then restart SourceTree
fields.summary: Window opening Crash

fields.description:
When resizing the graph column by double-click on the separator of the title, the graph column gets small. When double-clicking a second time, the column stays small but the graph is drawn over the description column.

This bug is somewhat related to several reports about the graph column not resizing to the "best" width.
fields.summary: The graph is drawn in front of the description column

fields.description:
Upgraded Sourctree to 2.0.20.1. And the CPU usage skyrocketed rendering the application almost unusable. Tried to rightclick for context menu to resolve a merge conflict and took around 30 secounds before it popped up. Also progress bar above file status keeps indicting some unknown process

!image-2017-05-30-15-47-45-038.png|width=582,height=145!
fields.summary: Sourctree eating 50-80% CPU after upgrade to 2.0.20.1

fields.description: When running the installer an attempting to login to Atlassian Account, the error message "Opps, you've made a malformed request" appears

fields.description: Using SourceTree requires an Atlassian ID. Is it possible to use our company’s Active Directory for authentication instead of Atlassian ID?
fields.summary: Using Company's Active Directory for Authentication for SourceTree
UI Icons bigger that should

fields.description:
in sourcetree, when using right click on file => git log, it will git log it for this branch only.
however it would be much more helpful, to either
a) by default git log -all, so we can see the commits of this file in all branches

OR
b) add a second option for "git log all" so user can decide what he wants.

atm git log -all is only available in terminal, but it is a feature that tremendously helps find issues/where something went wrong with the file - which is what git log is all about.
fields.summary: git log -all option (or default behaviour change)

fields.description:
I have tried to install the source Tree application in my Windows PC and during the step 'Atlassian Accounts' other window showing the message below, and I can not progress with installation. I don't know how to continue with installation.

!image-2017-05-29-15-14-15-763.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree installation issue during Atlassian Accounts step

fields.description: When I switched to an 3 month old branch, and Source Tree fetched older revisions to go back in time to that branch, user interface showed this broken lines and non-matching colours (see attached screenshot).
fields.summary: Multiple branches with older revisions show non-continuous lines

fields.description:
My "folders" in the left bar keep constantly collapsing.

I expand my local branches and everything on origin, for instance. All of a sudden, everything collapses again. This seems to happen at random and is very annoying.
fields.summary: Keep collapsed state of branches/remotes

fields.description:
If sourcetree is started with a maximised window from the previous session, the "Jump to" button and the scrollbar of the history on the right hand side seem to be cut off. In addition, the top bar of the app (file, edit, view etc) is also cut off, as if the screen was x pixels larger.

Restoring down and maximizing the window again seems to remove that issue. But it reappears after every restart. This seems to have been introduced with the latest beta.
fields.summary: Fullsize window is restored incorrectly

fields.description: With the latest beta, I encounter a weird jumping with the three icons to minimize, restore down and close the window. On click, they turn into the grey windows default icons (see attached screenshot [^strange_icon_behaviour.PNG]). It gets difficult to hit them, because sometimes the icons of the app work (trying to hit restore down, but hitting the close button of sourcetree).
fields.summary: Strange behaviour with minimize/restore/close buttons

fields.description:
When checking for updates (manual or during startup) SourceTree returns the following error:

!image-2017-05-29-11-59-10-157.png!
fields.summary: Checking for updates returns error

fields.description:
I have set my Windows taskbar to autohide. When you move the mouse to the bottom of the screen, the taskbar will appear and allow you to click on the start button, etc. The taskbar appears above all other windows.

SourceTree is the only application that I use that ignores this feature. If I maximize SourceTree's window and bring my mouse to the bottom of the screen, my taskbar is not visible. It will only become visible if I resize the window or switch to another application.

I have reproduced this issue on multiple computers. This is not a result of a Windows setting. There is no setting to change the taskbar's "always on top" feature in Windows 10. The default is "always on top" and SourceTree overrides this.
fields.summary: SoureTree window hides Windows taskbar

fields.description:
When using with git, in the file status tab, if you select to show all files, then modified and clean files are showed with the same yellow icon. This is counter intuitive.

In below .gitignore is modified and p_insertadpresponselog_trans.sql is clean.

!blob:8B1CC89D-EA3E-4AD0-AFC5-AB31CB607A56!

After any file content modified, the list of updated files are not getting refreshed Steps to reproduce.

The list is only shown when the repository settings are applied with the below shown screenshot, by toggling "automatically refresh" checkbox.

See attached screenshot for details.

fields.description:
When opening git repository with submodules SourceTree crashes. The resulting path to submodule .git folder is 280 symbols. Unfortunately there's no way to shorten this path.

The crash is caused by the fact that SourceTree 2.0 is now using libgit2 internally for "blazing fast performance". However this lib does not support long paths in Windows (see git core.longpaths setting). Legacy Windows API limitation is 255 symbols.

This is actually a showstopper for using SourceTree 2.0. The only workaround to downgrade to v1.9

Related libgit2 issue - [https://github.com/libgit2/libgit2/issues/3053]

Related TortoiseGit issue - [https://gitlab.com/tortoisegit/tortoisegit/issues/2784]

See sourcetree log attached
fields.summary: Libgit2 causes SourceTree crash when git submodules are used

fields.description:
When performing a complex rebase deep into a tree, the operation will occasionally fail due to "index.lock" being present, with a message about another git process in operation.  If the abort-rebase also fails, the repository can be left in an inconsistent state with possible data loss.

I suspect there is a background process in Sourcetree that is using a git command that monitors for changes/etc that remains active during the rebase process, and there is a race condition where sometimes it manages to grab the lock and causes the rebase to fail.  The fix is probably to suspend this process during the rebase and resume afterwards.

To reproduce, select a commit ~15 commits behind the current branch, and select "rebase children of DEADBEEF interactively".  Then squash some of the commits at the bottom, or edit some messages, etc to cause everything above it to be rebased onto the changed commit.

It does not occur every time, but farther back is more likely to cause it to reproduce, so try going farther back if you can't get it to reproduce.

Strangely, the bug does not seem to occur when running a command-line interactive rebase, even if SourceTree is still open (tested once or twice but not thoroughly confirmed)
fields.summary: Complex interactive-rebases fail due to index.lock w/ possible data loss

fields.description:
First, on the search tab, I enter a string and choose to look for it all file changes.
Then, a list of all commits appears that had this string in any diff; it looks like this list is ok.
Then, I select one of the commits listed. In the lower half of the pane, all files are listed that
had been changed by that commit; it looks like this list is ok.
However, when I can not find a way how to locate the specific diffs that had the searched-for
string modified in any way. I tried to enter that same string into the search field of the lower
half of the pane, but to no avail at all.
I had to locate all the pieces of code that had the searched-for string changed manually, by 
browsing through all the commit's files and then through all the files' diffs. VERY tedious.

Do I miss something? Is the second search not working?
fields.summary: Unable to locate a string in the diffs of a commit

fields.description: The UI can be inconsistent after a push or pull from another source, e.g., the command line. Observe in the attached snapshot how local and remote are in agreement yet ST wrongly claims local is one commit behind remote. No amount of refreshing (F5) will set it right.
fields.summary: Inconsistent UI state

fields.description:
I changed my password on my Linux system and now I can't push/pull via Atlassian SourceTree 2.0.20.1 gui.  I tried resetting via the authentication tab under Tools->Options but the password is not being saved.

I can use git via command line via Terminal because I am prompted for a password. 

I didn't have this issue in prior versions.  What do I need to do to resolve issue? I have googled for a solution and nothing worked so far. Should I just roll back to a prior version?
fields.summary: Password Reset
Add "push to here" to push some, but not all, local commits

fields.description:
Even if there are no changes in the branch, i always receive this alert. In the previous version 1.8 or 1.9  i did not see any such issues.

 

It happens irrespective of whether the branch was committed or not committed

This is getting annoying every time to get a message when switching branches

 

Thanks in advance for your support. I have attach the image for your refernce
fields.summary: I get a confirm switch alert every time i switch branches

fields.description:
While holding the window border and dragging it down to resize the window, at a certain distance (about 1/3 of screen height) the action will be canceled and the border will jump back up to a starting position. This is not a simple "you can't resize window this much" ban, because once the mouse has crossed this certain point, it not possible to return the mouse up and resume resizing, it effectively cancels the whole resizing action.

To make the matter more ridiculous, if you resize the window fast enough, you can pass this point, and the window will be resized fine, but if you raise the window close to that point again, the action will be canceled

The gif below explains it in action:

!hop2.gif|thumbnail!

and this shows what happens if you resize the window fast enough to cross the critical point:

!hop3.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Resizing the window border split jumps back at a certain point

fields.description:
Auto-refresh of changed files is really nice, but actually happens too often in some cases. The worst case I've seen is when I do "git rebase" on the command line. SourceTree recognizes that file changes are happening and tries to update the changed files list nearly constantly. The GUI does a lot of flashing when that happens and I know there are git processe(s) underneath trying to figure out the changes as my rebase runs. A similar problem happens when I do a build in Visual Studio. It would be great if auto-refresh was a little less eager to avoid this kind of problem. Maybe just putting a short timer between refreshes would be enough.

This issue was inspired by a comment on SRCTREEWIN-7174:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7174?focusedCommentId=1535291&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1535291
fields.summary: Reduce eagerness of auto-refresh

fields.description:
when we try to reset a branch that is available remotely, git throws an exception as it should be and SourceTree captures that message and shows it, but does not gives up any chance to force push the branch...

here's a comparison with Git Extensions:

[http://s6.postimg.org/yakd1kzdt/screenshot_80.png]

 

even when I'm trying to push the branch back to origin the "force push" checkbox is disabled

[http://s6.postimg.org/i0u6yoopt/screenshot_81.png]

 

using Git Extensions, it gives us the option to actually pull, rebase, merge, force the push or simply cancel the command...
fields.summary: Add ability to force a push

fields.description:
When I'm in a branch, it's very hard visually to keep track what are the changes for that branch:
[http://s6.postimg.org/73sv9x1y9/screenshot_77.png]

 

comparing with Git Extensions:

[http://s6.postimg.org/nsub5tyjl/screenshot_78.png]

 

things to notice:

1- all commits that "end up" in that branch have yellow background, so visually it's easier to follow up
2 - the branch line has one color (same as SourceTree) but all others are grayed out and that makes it really easy to visually check the descriptions.
fields.summary: It's hard to visualize the current branch commits

fields.description: when moving sourcetree window full screen, you drag the window to the screen you want it to be on. doesn't look like it has moved. Minimise the window and reopen it and it has moved
fields.summary: Moving sourcetree window when full screen

fields.description:
In a local repository, with multiple files in the unstaged changes (only requires 5 or so files, but happens with more too), the unstaged files list acts sporadically and causes some files to disappear from the list and re-appear when it sees fit...

For example, the files File1, File2, File3, File4 are in the list. File3 disappears. I click "Stage all" or select the changes and stage them. File3 might re-appear in the *unstaged* files list at this point or it might only re-appear after I've commited changes.

This has led me recently to have to do multiple commits for the same thing as not all files have been staged properly, quite annoying!
fields.summary: Changes appearing/disappearing in unstaged files

fields.description:
After clicking the "+" icon to browse local repositories, double clicking on a repository in the list does nothing (no activity, no background activity reported either in task manager).

Closing SourceTree and re-opening the issue then allows me to open repositories again.

This usually occurs after SourceTree has been running for a few hours, I rarely close it and the PC isn't shut down or slept or restarted unless for updates.
fields.summary: Cannot open local repository

fields.description:
# Require 2 or more opened repos
 # Open Log Selected dialog for any file for 2 or more repos
 # Rescale Log window
Problem : Rescale affects second window
fields.summary: Multiple Log windows scaling

fields.description:
Recently we have federated our test Jira instance with ADFS (through Azure AD).  When we did that, all @pnimedia domain accounts became federated (including those in production Jira instance).

Now I have some QA trying to login to Atlassian Sourcetree rich client application.  As expected, the Sourcetree contacts ADFS for federated login.  However, Sourcetree fails to complete login journey when iexplore.exe control fails to load for final AD credential challenge. This seems to be a bug in Sourcetree; we cannot force the iexplore window to open.

Do note that web app federated login is working fine (tested in IE, Chrome and Firefox).

See the screen shots attached with our login sequence.  It ended up with a blank screen.
fields.summary: Can't login Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
Maybe this has already been added or a bug exists, but at least I was not able to find anything. 

I am trying to download a repository which seems to be stuck for a while. Even though I check the Show Full Output I just see the blue bar come and go.

!image-2017-05-23-11-47-08-611.png!

And I know it is not nice to show competing products, and even though I use SourceTree primarily, I started the same clone with a separate client to see if something is wrong and I can see several details that give me an indication of where the process is.

!image-2017-05-23-11-48-18-735.png!

 

This could be a very nice improvement that "should not be hard to do". Actually, it might, but it will definitively improve user experience.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Progress Counters

fields.description:
When changing files in the File Status screen, the DIFF on the right side has an animation that slides the screen up about 15-20 pixels. While it's sliding up, the text is blurry. 
 # I don't understand the point of the animation.
 # I can't turn off the animation.
 # The biggest problem is that for a second, my eyes are trying to readjust to the blurry text because my brain thinks that my eyes are out of focus. Once the text "sets" and goes back into focus, my eyes have to refocus.

Bottom line: it +physically+ hurts after a while of my eyes focusing and refocusing each time I change a file because of an unnecessary animation.

Options:
 # Remove the unnecessary animation.
 # Put in a setting to turn off animations.

Thanks
fields.summary: Text is blurry as the diff window slides up

fields.description:
Selecting text in the diff view, in previous versions of SourceTree for Windows, would enable the Edit > Copy menu item and allow me to copy the text.

This current version of SourceTree (2.0.20.1) does not let me do this anymore.  The Edit menu exists, but all six items on it (undo, redo, cut, copy, paste, select all) are disabled.

I would expect that when I've selected text in the diff view, the copy menu item (though none of the others) would be enabled.

This seriously hinders SourceTree as a tool for going back and finding edits in earlier code, and restoring them.

(It would be even better if right-clicking on the selected text brought up a "Copy" popup menu – right now right-clicking the selected text just deselects it, which is not Windows behavior.)

Thank you for a great app in general, and especially for the GVFS support :)
fields.summary: Edit / Copy not enabled when selecting text in diff view

fields.description: If you have the same repo cloned to multiple locations (same name)and you search, all the listing entries look the same.  If you could add the bookmark folder or the repo path (like in sourcetree 1), that would help in determining which repo you are selecting.
fields.summary: Display repo path or bookmark folder in new Open repo selection

fields.description:
After an update from 1.9.6.2 to 2.0.20.1 SourceTree appears to no longer remember the password per user per host. It remembers one password per host.

For example, the repository URL:

[https://username@github.com/username/repo.git]

requires you to enter both a username and a password (which could be a different username, even). SourceTree will then remember this as the default username and password for github.com.

This is different from earlier behaviour where the password was remembered per user per host. So you could have the repositories:

[https://username1@github.com/username1/repo1.git|https://username1@github.com/username1/repo.git]

and

[https://username2@github.com/username2/repo2.git|https://username1@github.com/username1/repo.git]

and push and pull from either remote. After the update, entering the username and password for the first remote causes interactions with the second remote (that require authentication) to fail due to a 403 error because it is the same host.

Additionally, after the update the passwords stored per user per host still appear in the settings, but they appear not to be used anymore.
fields.summary: SourceTree asks for username and password for git https:// urls with a username in it, and stores the password per host

fields.description: Can't copy several lines in changed files. Just one by one line can be copied at Windows SourceTree application.
fields.summary: Can't copy several lines in changed files

fields.description: badly scaled icons on the left side panel https://www.screencast.com/t/2rnIBELbrPo
fields.summary: Icons overlaps text on the left side tree

fields.description: client configuration api 1
fields.summary: client configuration api 1
Column Resize highly unintuitive

fields.description: SourceTree is not properly closing all background git.exe processes that are spawned during background refreshes checks - by default one git.exe process spawns up for each repo, but in some cases, these processes are not being properly closed after the refresh is finished.
fields.summary: SourceTree is not properly closing all git.exe spawned processes after startup.

fields.description:
In your [latest blog post|https://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2017/05/18/windows-2-0-gets-a-fresh-look/] you show pictures of the upcoming interface. It features a new commit history that uses lots of white space.

Please reconsider this decision. Space is a very limited resource on screen, especially if you have to use a laptop screen (on the road, train, etc.). I do get your goal of making the list more readable by adding space around the lines but showing only a small number of lines removes a lot of the context, an information very important in a commit.
fields.summary: Rething your decision to reduce number of lines in commit history

fields.description:
* Have a local branch checked out.
 * In the left pane, right-click a remote branch (typically the one of which the current one was branched off), select "pull origin/xyz into current branch".
 * The pull dialog pops up, note the "remote branch to pull" dropdown: Instead of the remote branch you just clicked on, it has the tracking branch of the current branch selected (I guess).
 * You have to select the proper remote branch again, from the dropdown.

 

This bug already existed in previous versions.
fields.summary: Pull origin branch into current selects wrong branch

fields.description:
Recently I have updated my sourcetree to version 2.0.20. It is occupying all of my RAM a minimum og 3Gb and the application is very slow. Frequently I am seeing application is not responding. 

See the attached screenshot for more information !Screenshot_17.png!
fields.summary: Recent update to version 2.0 occupying my RAM

fields.description:
Synchronization between source tree and sublime text is not happening. Tried uninstalling and re-installing but nothing works.

Please help in finding a solution.
fields.summary: Data not syncing between sublime text and source tree
Sourcetree cannot be set up to use system mercurial installation

fields.description: The login tab doesn't allow deletion of certain saved passwords. On click, the specific foldouts just collapse with no change. Removing the associated accounts just adds another saved password entry that's not deletable either. Reinstalling SourceTree doesn't change that behaviour. This needs to be possible for publicly accessible computers
fields.summary: Saved passwords not deletable
Icons are not displayed correctly in Windows 10

fields.description:
The local branch tree, remotes and stashes seems to collapse after a refresh, which happens often it gets annoying playing with the beta.

 

Was able to reproduce it by having no uncommitted changes, deleting a branch from the remote and selecting another one. Sometimes it is not even possible to click a different branch because the tree collapses again.

 

-Problem does not occur in latest stable-
fields.summary: Branch-tree and remotes collapsing after refresh
Created in error (Delete this Issue)

fields.description:
After updating to v2.0.20.1, can no longer push to previously working Bitbucket repo.  I reset my Atlassian account password and retried, uninstalled-reinstalled, retried.  Upon pushing to git repo (verified the URL was correct) it fails.  I am repeatedly presented with an Atlassian-Bitbucket-Sourcetree logon dialog.  I tried reentering cred (using my Atlassian account creds - including full email address for user) and while no login error occurs, the push still fails with the same error and I get another login dialog.

NOTE: Screen capture of Sourcetree error failed to attach to this bug ticket with error "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again"  I retried twice with different image file formats (.PNG and .BMP)
fields.summary: After updating to v2.0.20.1, can't push to previously working Bitbucket repo

fields.description:
Since the latest update, the push window now lists all remote branches in the local branch column, i.e:
 
 | push | local branch | remote branch |
 | / | master | master |
 | | origin/HEAD | |
 
 As some of our repositories have quite a few branches, this makes the window a lot harder to view.
fields.summary: Update now lists all remote branches in push window

fields.description:
Issue occurs when appending a file's contents to another file and deleting the source file.
 Steps to reproduce.
 
 First commit: Commit 2 files (a.txt and b.txt) with content to repository and push.
 Second commit: append the contents of a.txt to the bottom of file b.txt and delete file a.txt
 Stage changes:
 Observer incorrect behavior: In staged changes i can see that file b.txt is marked as renamed, which is wrong.
 File b.txt should be marked as modified and file a.txt should be maked as deleted.
fields.summary: Move file contents inside another file is marked as file rename instead of addition
Crashed many times

fields.description:
On the "Starting repository" portion of the Windows installer. (The most recent one currently listed on the website.) When you provide an invalid destination for your repository clone, you are given the error message, "Invalid clone path. Folder must be exist and also be empty."
 
 "Folder must be exist and also be empty" should instead say, "Folder must exist and be empty."
fields.summary: Bad grammar on cloning portion of Sourcetree installer

fields.description: In the new 2.0.20.1, the workflow for pushing changes using shortcuts has bug. If the cursor is located in the message/commit textarea, and press the "Push" button (or use the keyboard shortcut), the cursor will still be focused in the commit textarea, therefore pressing "enter" key will add a new line in the greyed texteare and not pushing the changes.
fields.summary: Pushing using keyboard shortcuts in 2.0

fields.description:
There doesn't appear to be any way to change the text shown on a repo's tab.

I think this used to be possible on older versions using the Bookmarks window, but the bookmarks window appears to have been removed.

You can see this by, e.g., cloning the same repo into two different folders, and opening both working copies. Both tabs then have the same title.
fields.summary: Can't change repo tab text

fields.description:
We are on sourcetree 1.9.9.20 and planning to upgrade to 2.0.20.1 to address vulnerabilities. As 2.0 is designed to get installed under users local, its against our firms standards and we are looking out for options to point installation to c:\program files x(86)\Atlassian\SourceTree or any other folder.

We have tried batch and powershell to change the default location but that didnt help.
fields.summary: Sourcetree install location

fields.description: Adding option to close ssh agent would be great.
fields.summary: Close ssh agent when closing sourcetree

fields.description:
This bug looks like it was introduced in SourceTree 2.0.20.
 
 When merging from one branch to another results in conflicts, the chngeset shown in the "staged files" window is showing the *inverse* changes.
 i.e. If I'm in branch 1 and merging from branch 2, the changeset shows the changes as if branch 2 is the original version, rather than branch 1.
 
 Please see my screencast to see this in action: [https://www.screencast.com/t/xqRPzWyV]
fields.summary: Merging branches with conflict shows diff in the wrong direction

fields.description:
When did you first see the issue?
 - When attempting to reorder the local repositories
 
 How often does the issue occur?
 - Always
 
 Is it only you who is experiencing this?
 - I don't know, but i guess no.
 
 What steps can we follow to reproduce this?
 - Open "+" tab.
 - select a folder with local repositories in it
 - drag a local repository to reorder them.
 - When I want to move it 1 down it actually moves 2 down.
 - If I move it $i down it moves $i+1 down.
 - Moving it up works as expected.
fields.summary: reordering the local repositories is behaving wrong

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the moment, it's not possible to disable it. For each little action I have to wait a minute until it went through all submodules.   

h3. Environment
SourceTree Version: 2.0.20.1
Using embedded git
Check submodules before commit & push: off
fields.summary: Ability to disable git submodule status calls

fields.description: When clicking on a remote branch in the left pane, the right pane often does not react at all (as in previous versions). On some occasions, this click will also trigger the "fetching older commits..." progress thingy, without any apparent success. Even when the branch in question is at the very top of the current tree, scroll down somewhere in the tree, click on branch -> "fetching older commits...".
fields.summary: Constantly "Fetching older commits..."

fields.description:
Congratulations on finally getting the alphabetic sorting right. ;)

I still have two issues though:

Please differentiate between "foldered" branches (like a/fine/branch) and "direct" branches (like master). I think it would be good idea to display the direct branches first (because they are usually more important or more relevant to more people), followed by the foldered branches, each block sorted alphabetically of course.

The increased line spacing, which you even boldly advertised as an improvement, is actually not a good idea. Might be fine when you only have a few remote branches, but when the list gets longer, you have to scroll a lot. Plus I don't think it actually contributes to readability or overview.
fields.summary: Branch sorting in the left pane

fields.description:
* open SourceTree window maximized
 * hover mouse over left or right border
 * mouse cursor changes to resize cursor
 * resize the window
 * window is now in a strange state, restore icon is not changed to maximize icon
 * only after vertically resizing the window, it can be maximized again

I have two monitors with different sizes. When the main window is resized as described above, a remainder of the window is painted on the other monitor, even after it is maximized again on the first monitor.

You can not drag the window to a second monitor when maximized by grabbing it at the title bar. Hot keys work though.

And last but most upsetting: The maximized SourceTree window prevents the Windows taskbar from appearing. (I have it set on auto-hide and at the bottom.)
fields.summary: UI: Faulty main window behavior

fields.description:
* click on branch icon in toolbar, select "delete branches" tab
 * note that all branches on origin are listed twice, once as local and once as remote
 * try to delete an origin branch marked as local -> "error: branch 'origin/xyz' not found.

As an added inconvenience, this makes the list of branches to browse very long.
fields.summary: Delete branches: local / remote confusion

fields.description: I work at a large software development company, I have really enjoyed using source tree. However your last update sucks balls, why would you make such drastic changes to your UI, whoever made that decision needs to go on a UX design course. Anyway, just to let you know you are loosing customers to GitKrakken in droves and this change is probably going to cost you many developers from one company alone... just saying...
fields.summary: UX Suggestions

fields.description: It would be handy if you could copy the hash of the currently selected commit in the commit list box on the Search tab with Edit->Copy or Ctrl+C the same way you can copy the selected commit in the Log / History tab
fields.summary: Enable copy in search results commit list box
Enable users to copy contents of log/history window to clipboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We had a Windows 7 developer using SourceTree 1.9.x with a Mercurial repository.    Commits were pushed and pulled to a repo on a linux box on our local network via ssh:

   ssh://linuxbox//path/to/repo

When they updated to SourceTree 2.0.20.1, the ssh remotes on the linux box stopped working.  We'd get a repeated "Windows Security" dialog for "Git Credential Manager for Windows" / "Enter your credentials for https://linuxbox/"  and username and password, but entering the proper values just keep cycling through the same dialog. 

Checking some details after cancelling showed {{Error reading SSH_ASKPASS output for prompt: Unsupported prompt}}
{code}[login as: ]@linuxbox's password
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!{code}

Reverting to SourceTree 1.9.9 and everything works fine again!  I did a very tiny test with embedded Git and 2.0.20.1, and it seems to get past the ssh connection properly, the problems seems limited to 2.0+Mercurial+ssh. 

h3. Environment

The "General/SSH Client" preference is PuTTY/Plink, as it was under 1.9 (we have PuTTY 0.6.9). For the remote, we have a debian running mercurial 3.1.2 and ubuntu with mercurial 3.7.3, and SourceTree is using embeded Mercurial 3.7.3.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.0 and Mercurial fail with SSH remotes

fields.description:
Borders of window are out of screen. so I cannot toucjthem with mouse to resize. 

Dragging title not work, maximize button not work, only Win+arrow key helps
fields.summary: Log Selected window openes fullscreen and not resizable

fields.description:
At the moment it is not possible to close the last tab. The close button simply doesn't do anything at all. 

Desired functionality:
 * close last tab automaticly reopens the repositories list

Current functionality:
 * closing last tab does not do anything
 * I have to press the "+"-button first
 * then close the previous tab
fields.summary: Closing last tab should automaticly reopen the repositories list.

fields.description:
When I install SourceTree 2.0.20.1, the installer does not give any prompts or show any dialogs. My computer will show the busy cursor for a few seconds, then the SourceTree application main window displays. I used Task Manager to find the location of the application. The app and all its files were installed in C:\Users\Marc\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-2.0.20.1. Opening the shortcut under Start menu - Atlassian/SourceTree runs the same executable in that folder.

This is highly unusual and it seems the installer is messed up. 1) No dialogs during install. 2) No options for where to install or anything else. 3) Installing app to an 'app data' folder instead of Program Files. 4) Installer automatically runs application with no prompts.
fields.summary: Installer for 2.0.20.1 installs to /users/AppData/Local/SourceTree/app-2.0.20.1

fields.description:
When the Window Display Settings for text size (screenshot attached) is anything other than 100%, the icons in the left hand tree (branches/tags/remotes etc.) don't scale correctly - they appear to be extraordinary large even with only 125% text size selected.

 

I have included a screenshot from two different setups, one is with 28" monitors with 100% text scale - icons appear scaled correctly. The second is from a 12" UHD laptop with 125% text scale - icons are extra large.
fields.summary: Branch/Remote tree icons don't scale with font-size of windows

fields.description:
Please bring back the repository treeview. This is an important feature that I use all the time. With the current 2.x implementation, even if I click on the plus button to switch to other repositories, I can't see which ones have uncommitted changes. That defeats the whole purpose I am using SourceTree. At least I request that this be made an option for advanced users.

Our work uses many repositories simultaneously in the same project. Often there are changes to be checked in for multiple repositories. To see what repositories need check-ins made, I look at SourceTree. Without this feature my work becomes MUCH harder. I have to downgrade to 1.x until this feature is re-implemented in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Bring back repository treeview to 2.x releases

fields.description: Using scale 125% on full HD 15.6'' monitor.
fields.summary: Bad layout with Windows scale

fields.description:
See image sequence for details...

 

Another "brilliance": when trying to enter my current ST version, I get: "Version with id '1.9.13.7' does not exist."
fields.summary: Update of 1.9.13.7 fails

fields.description:
I have recently upgraded Source Tree to version 2.0.20.1 due to the announced security issue. Since doing so I am no longer able to create pull requests from my branch. I get a messages that the remote I am tracking does not have integrated settings enabled. This is not the case as per the attached screen shot. We have notice there are also some issues with the selected tracked branch not sticking. Could this all be related.

Any assistance would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Sourcetreeconfig corruption - unable to create pull requests, collapsing the sidebar tree, missing git subtrees

fields.description: There used to be checkboxes next to the files in the Unstaged/Staged files list. Please bring those back. Having to drag drop is very annoying and time consuming.
fields.summary: Bring back checkbox to stage files

fields.description:
When the taskbar is set to auto-hide, maximizing SourceTree will cover it. Moving the mouse to the edge of the screen does not expand the taskbar anymore.

This happens when the taskbar is on any edge of the monitor. My use-case specifically is the left edge.
fields.summary: Sourcetree covers windows taskbar when taskbar is attached to the side of the monitor and set to auto-hide

fields.description:
* Set SourceTree maximised on a secondary screen.
 * Close SourceTree.
 * Reopen SourceTree and it will appear maximised on the primary screen.

This behaviour doesn't seem to occur if SourceTree is not maximised when it is closed.
fields.summary: Window position is not retained when restarted

fields.description:
An example:
Step 1: Right mouse on a local branch and click Rename
Step 2: Rename dialog appears and the text input is highlighted
Step 3: Click in the text to position the cursor
Step 4: Highlight disappears, BUT THERE IS NO visible cursor.
fields.summary: Cursor not present in SourceTree when not using single native display.

fields.description:
After using maven release plugin for the first time on a repo (the one on the screenshot was converted from hg, that's why the version number does seem to show the first release), the TAG that is created appears as if it was on the head of a branch. This "branch" contains all commits before the tag, except for the other commit that was created by maven release plugin which appears to be on a different "branch". 
 I have experienced this in multiple repositories, and my colleagues also experienced this in sourcetree in different versions. I heard that GitKraken also has some issue with this.
 
 I would say, to reproduce, commit some changes, then do a maven release with the maven release plugin, then commit some other changes and do another release -- this should result in a similar situation as can be seen on the attached screenshot.
 
 Thanks for looking into this, I couldn't find anything on google, maybe I used the wrong keywords for the search.
fields.summary: tag on master appears like a separate branch

fields.description:
Hello, I just installed the latest version of source tree. It seems to be a great update, but the very helpful repositories/bookmarks left panel was removed.

I am asking if it is possible to restore this feature.

The problem is that I work (probably a lot of users too) with several git repos from many projects, which I had organized by folders at many levels, now I had to work with this all projects at tabs level.

I am wondering how to work with more than 40 tabs, including that if I close one of them I need to remember where are placed those repos to restore again when I need it.

So please, consider restoring this feature again I and other users will to appreciate that.

Thanks.

PD: Please, sorry if you find grammar errors
fields.summary: Restore the repositories (bookmarks) tree panel

fields.description:
When I fetch with "Fetch all tags" unticked, sourcetree still fetches all tags.

This causes long running "Fetching older commits..." because it goes back to the oldest tag.

This is because the tag behavior is changed in git 2.12:

By default, tags that point at objects that are downloaded from the remote repository are fetched and stored locally. This option disables this automatic tag following. The default behavior for a remote may be specified with the remote.<name>.tagOpt setting.

So --no-tags should be added when "Fetch all tags" is not ticked or a checkbox should be added. (like: Do not Fetch any tags)
fields.summary: Fetch with "Fetch all tags" unticked still fetches all tags
